intro: Aciotis levyana, commonly known as the Levantine goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Aciotis levyana is often found in open areas such as slopes and gravelly soils.
